results.title: The Spirit of physical education
results.creator_credit: John Kingsford-Smith, Kingcroft Productions and Department of Education of NSW
results.brief_description: The new syllabus in physical education introduced by the New South Wales Department of Education was enthusiastically adopted by teachers in primary schools. In this film, groups of school boys and girls demonstrate a variety of group exercises and show how they enjoy this new approach to physical education. The film emphasises the value of such group activity in building character and self-confidence, in developing healthy social attitudes and in providing healthy physical exercise.

results.title: The Spirit moves: jazz dance from turn of the century 'til 1950
results.creator_credit: Mura Dehn and Dehn and Matter
results.brief_description: Filmed over 30 years in the director’s dance studio and in the Harlem Savoy Ballroom “The Spirit Moves” is a unique assembly of jazz routines, through the development of the art. From ragtime, struts, cakewalk, through blues, bebop to calypso, mambo and rock and roll. Performed by the artists of the Savioy Ballroom of Harlem and narrated by Mura Dehn. Filmed in black and white with final 15 minute segment in colour.

results.title: The Spiny Ant-eater
results.creator_credit: Arthur Hansen and Australian Instructional Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Wild Life”.
Sequence of shots of the Spiny Ant-Easter digging into the ground. The differences between it and European porcupines are explained as well as the unique characteristics of this strange Australian mammal.

results.title: The Spike
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Documentary which explains the disease of epilepsy and looks at research which is being done into its causes and how to treat it. Includes extensive interviews with epilepsy sufferers who describe their symptoms and their feelings about the disease and the social stigma attached to it. Presented and narrated by Dr Peter Fenwick.

results.title: The Spider = Earth vs the spider
results.creator_credit: American International Pictures (AIP), Santa Rosa Productions and Bert I. Gordon
results.brief_description: When her father goes missing Carol and her teenage boyfriend go searching for him. What they find is a giant spider lurking in a nearby cave. Although initially rescued, the town becomes imperilled when the seemingly deceased spider is revived. B-grade director and special effects creator Bert I. Gordon specialised in cheap horror films, usually featuring teenagers in danger from a marauding beast. He does not disappoint here, and although the special effects are fairly outmoded, the film has enduring cult value. Highlights are the Theremin soundtrack and the use of the Carlsbad Caverns National Park in New Mexico, as the spider’s lair.

results.title: The Specialist
results.creator_credit: Robert Verrall, Zagreb Film, ONF | NFB, Boris Kolar and Don Arioli
results.brief_description: An amusingly drawn cartoon about a highly proficient lady bricklayer, graduate of Specialists’ School, whose work takes her high up in the world, and her erstwhile friend, whose equally dedicated professionalism brings him lower. She builds towers of bricks while he tunnels down below ground. What develops in the story involves other unlikely characters, plausible enough in this cartoon context.

results.title: The Special Effects of Karel Zeman
results.brief_description: A documentary on the work of Karel Zeman who is a famous Czech animator. Zeman created a variety of puppets and drew other characters who often interacted with real people in his films. Footage from the Zeman archives is included, and although there is some narration the emphasis is on the visuals.

results.title: The Special brain of Karl Kroyer. Parts 1 & 2
results.brief_description: Focuses on the work of Danish inventor Karl Kroyer. His 200-odd patents have made him a millionaire many times over. Kroyer’s carefully planned and controlled processes of thought allow him to continue to tackle a dazzling and diverse range of problems. Some of his inventions include: the non-stick frying-pan, glass roads, paper made without water, and new methods for raising sunken ships.
